content: rectangle granny bookmark materials small amount of #10 crochet thread in color or colors of your choice #5 1 9 mm crochet hook embroidery needle for weaving in ends/threading tassel abbreviations chain…chain stitch double_crochet…double_crochet single_crochet…single_crochet slip_stitch…slip_stitch special stitches double_crochet cluster in next chain-1 space 3 double_crochet chain 1 notes instructions as given assume that this is worked in a single color to change colors at the end of a round simply fasten_off with the old color and join a new color with a slip_stitch in any space chain 3 2 double_crochet chain 1 and work the round as usual from that point for photos of one of these in various stages of completion see http //neatlytangled com/index php/patterns/rectangle-granny-bookmark/ finished size 1 75 inches 4 5 cm wide by 5 5 inches 14 cm long plus tassel pattern base row chain 50 double_crochet in 6th chain from hook and in next 2 chain *chain 1 skip one chain in starting chain double_crochet in next 3 chain * repeat from * to * across 11 clusters chain 1 and double_crochet in last chain of starting chain round 1 chain 3 2 double_crochet in space formed by final double_crochet of base row really needs a pic here chain 2 3 double_crochet in same space chain 1 work a double_crochet cluster in the next chain-1 space and each chain-1 space across in chain-5 space at the end of the base row work 3 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 1 then work a double_crochet cluster in next chain-1 space and each chain-1 space across 3 double_crochet chain 2 in same space the round began in join to beginning chain 3 with a slip_stitch slip_stitch in next 2 double_crochet and in chain-2 space rounds 2 and 3 chain 3 2 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 1 work double_crochet cluster in each chain-1 space across and 3 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 1 in each corner join as in round 1 round 4 chain 1 turn single_crochet in each double_crochet and each chain-1 space to corner in corner space single_crochet ch2 single_crochet repeat around join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet round 5 chain 3 turn you re now working on the original right side double_crochet in each single_crochet to corner in corner double_crochet ch2 double_crochet repeat around slip_stitch to first double_crochet fasten_off tassel cut at least 20 12 inch lengths of thread more if you d like the tassel particularly dense thread through stitches on one end of bookmark centering each strand so it is doubled gather fringe together and tie knot to form tassel block it and you re done the rectangle granny bookmark crochet pattern is copyright 2007 by deborah ellis please do not reproduce this pattern without explicit permission to do so please feel free however to sell any items that you make from this pattern if you have any questions at all please contact the author at neatlytangled@gmail com thank you
